summary:
If I were asked to choose one trait that best describes me as a person, it would be my strong passion for and genuine interest in people. Whether it’s at work or in life, my focus is on being the best I can be and helping others do the same, as only then, and with confidence, comes the power to achieve full potential.

My personal strength lies in connection – bringing people together by facilitating dialogue and creating a common understanding. By doing so, I am able to bring about change and deliver tangible business results. I am not afraid to take on new challenges and more often than not I find myself being a driving force to success. 

I consider myself a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion. I believe that inclusive societies not only benefit individuals, but enable companies and economies to flourish. That’s why I am committed to being an active leader in Shell’s LGBTQ+ network, ensuring that LGBTQ+ staff are accepted, valued and given equal opportunities to develop.

I also have an unquenchable thirst for learning, in any form or shape: be it books, people, or travels. After growing up in Mexico, I moved to the Netherlands in 2007, and over the years I have gained broad international experience through work and study placements in several countries. Through my work with Street Child and the visits to Sierra Leone and Nepal, I have been able to witness true responsible leadership first hand, supporting thousands of children off the streets, back to their families and to school.

treasury_media.title: Interview: We zijn samen op reis | We are Finance Magazine Editie 2 2019
treasury_media.description: This is an article (in Dutch) from an interview my colleague Lyn Lee - Shell's Chief D&I Officer role - and I as the lead of the LGBT+ network had with the 'We are Finance' magazine, a publication from the Dutch Association of Register Controllers (Vereniging van Register Controllers). It talks about Shell's diversity policy and ambition, and sheds some light into our work as D&I ambassadors in Shell.

school.name: Stanford University Graduate School of Business
Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)
De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: International Business Project for the Union for Ethical BioTrade
projects.description:
The Union for Ethical BioTrade (UEBT) is a non-profit organisation whose aim is to promote the sourcing with respect of natural ingredients by working closely with member companies across various industries. When becoming members to UEBT, companies must adhere to a series of membership obligations, including the continuous reporting on a series of biodiversity indicators. These indicators provide both UEBT and member companies with insight into the scope of the application of the UEBT standard, as well as the potential impact on biodiversity.

Based on this research, the team identified several ways in which the indicators developed by UEBT can be integrated with the internal reporting practices and systems used by member companies, while keeping the administrative burden to a minimum. In addition, the team provided practical recommendations to UEBT on how to create a system of indicators which is practical and easy to use, in order to facilitate companies in consistently adhering to UEBT standards and at the same time support their own operations and decision-making processes.

contributors.headline: Business Development Manager Specialties at Implenia

profile_positions.description:
- Led the completion of the divestment of Shell’s Upstream business in Denmark for a consideration of $1.9 billion, working intensively with the deal team to meet the complex demands of the project, which required creative deal structures, extensive multilateral negotiations and novel liability mitigation through the insurance industry. 
- Supported the acquisition of Eolfi, a French renewable energy developer specialised in floating offshore wind projects, where I led the initial valuation of the onshore portfolio.
profile_positions.title: Analyst M&A and Commercial Finance

profile_positions.description:
Final rotation within the Finance Graduate scheme.

As a Planning & Appraisal analyst, one of my key responsibilities was to support the annual Business Plan process for the Integrated Gas Development business, which is the line of business in Shell accountable for the development of a global portfolio of growth projects in liquefied natural gas (LNG) and Gas to Liquids (GTL). I was also supporting the monthly and quarterly performance appraisal processes, reviewing variances between Actuals, Latest Estimates and Plan numbers, and reporting the results to senior management.

During the year, I played a leading role in the development of a new performance management scorecard, including new competitiveness and cost efficiency KPIs in line with the strategic priorities of the business. Lastly, I conducted an analysis of feasibility expenditure across the growth portfolio, working closely with the Strategy & Portfolio team, providing valuable insights to top management in terms of capital allocation and suggesting ways for project teams to manage their Feasex budgets using Top Quartile benchmarks.
profile_positions.title: Planning & Appraisal Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Following the acquisition of the BG Group in February 2016, I became a member of the core finance team responsible for the integration of all financial and reporting elements, including overall alignment of people, systems, processes and data. Working alongside BG and Shell staff in one of the largest mergers in the energy industry, our focus as a team was to set up a transition organisation to successfully deliver the 2016 reporting requirements (both internal and external) and a long-term sustainable solution for the years to come.

Key responsibilities/achievements:
- Conducted an analysis of BG accounting policy and proposed solutions to bring it in line with Shell practice.
- Supported the fair valuation process of all BG assets and assumed liabilities as required by IFRS, as well as the recognition of goodwill in the Shell accounts.
- Supported the design and implementation of new MI packs in line with Shell’s KPI definitions and business structure.
- Supported the migration of over 400 FTEs worth of activities within the BG Finance scope (across more than 14 countries) into Finance Operations centres in Europe and Asia.
profile_positions.title: Finance Integration Analyst

profile_positions.description:
As a Business Accounting analyst within the Group Accounting & Reporting team I was a key contributor to the quarterly closing and financial consolidation process of the Royal Dutch Shell Group. Working closely with members of the Tax, Controllers and Finance Operations teams, one of my main responsibilities was to ensure the quality, accuracy and consistency of the financial data reported in the general ledger and consolidation system. Furthermore, I served as focal point for business finance colleagues throughout the organisation, providing advice to resolve accounting issues or questions arising at the corporate and group levels, as well as giving general guidance regarding the application of Shell accounting & reporting standards.

During my time in this team, I was responsible for the preparation of the quarterly note for the Audit Committee, containing a summary of all the main accounting topics of the period. These included major and complex portfolio transactions, the implementation of new accounting standards, changes to accounting policies, etc. In addition, I was also responsible for the preparation of several notes to the financial statements in the Annual Report, and provided regular analysis of data for the quarterly Board of Directors pack and other internal MI packs.
profile_positions.title: Business Accounting Analyst

profile_positions.description:
(Full-time work placement within the finance team of Shell's Projects & Technology division)
- Conducted an in-depth review of P&T Credit organisation and processes, leading to the migration of all third party receivables and credit-related activities of the P&T Commercial Services and CRI/Criterion businesses from a small team in Finance Operations into a Global Downstream Credit organisation.
- Responsible for overseeing and managing the restructuring process, as well as coordinating a global team and group of stakeholders across various departments, regions and levels in the organisation.
profile_positions.title: Intern - Finance and Control

profile_positions.description:
(Part-time position simultaneous with studies)
- Responsible for reviewing and providing advice on business development opportunities within the oil & gas industry, with particular focus on the EMEA region. 
Additional tasks include: 
- Identifying regional markets for sales and intelligence gathering on regional upstream players.
- Liaison with key internal and external stakeholders to help support new and existing businesses.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Advisor

profile_positions.description:
(Part-time position simultaneous with studies)
- Responsible for monitoring market developments and assessing current trends in the geothermal energy industry in the Netherlands, and reporting to senior management team on key strategic issues to support and improve the decision-making process. 
- Performed a risk analysis on alternative growth strategies for T&A Energy, a sister company specialised in the development of geothermal energy projects, as bachelor dissertation.
- Conducted a feasibility study on the construction of a geothermal system for one of the firm’s clients, and developed a business plan for the project requiring a total investment of roughly 8,5 million euros.
profile_positions.title: Industry Analyst - Geothermal Energy

profile_positions.description:
- Management of the In-House Bank’s treasury and banking systems for the EMEAA region, including the execution of daily operations to ensure an efficient concentration and dispersion of funds within the group. 
- Pricing of intra-group loans and investments under an arm’s-length basis and in line with all transfer pricing requirements on each jurisdiction. 
- Developed and implemented a standardised report for senior management and other stakeholders, facilitating up-to-date flow of information regarding loan agreements and amendments, which improved the decision-making process significantly.
profile_positions.title: Intern - International Treasury Management

volunteer_experiences.description:
As chairman of Shell’s LGBTQ+ employee resource group (ERG) in the Netherlands, I was responsible for leading a diverse team of 5-10 volunteers. Having developed a new strategy, our network’s objectives focused on: 1) providing support and development opportunities for LGBTQ+ employees, 2) raising awareness of LGBT+ issues in the workplace and providing advise to HR and senior management on how to address these, 3) representing Shell externally as an equal opportunity employer, and 4) contributing positively to the LGBTQ+ communities in the locations we operate.

During my tenure as lead of the network, our membership base grew from 250 to more than 1200 members, including more than 800 allies after the successful introduction of the Ally programme in 2016. We secured the support from various senior leaders in Shell, including our CFO Jessica Uhl who became global executive sponsor of the LGBTQ+ networks. As part of our internal and external awareness campaigns, my team carried out various initiatives such as the lighting of our Amsterdam offices in rainbow colours, the painting of the rainbow flag on the storage tank at Pernis refinery, a global social media campaign in 2017 for Coming Out Day, and an award-winning campaign in which we transformed four of our Retail stations around Amsterdam for Pride in 2018, a first for our industry.

Street Child Nederland is a charity that aims to create educational opportunities for some of the most vulnerable children in the world. Our focus is on empowering children by giving them the chance to go to school and giving their families the wherewithal to keep them there.

We work in collaboration with Street Child UK, one of the most widespread educational development organisations working in West Africa, helping over 20,000 children a year gain an education.
